gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: The Land Cover of the World in the Year 2000

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Land Cover of the World 2000 is a product of the GVM Unit that is coordinating and implementing the GLOBAL LAND COVER 2000 Project (GLC 2000) in collaboration with a network of partners around the world, under the coordination of the European Commission's Joint Research Centre. To achieve its objective GLC 2000 makes use of the VEGA 2000 dataset: a dataset of 14 months of pre-processed daily global data acquired by the VEGETATION instrument on board the SPOT 4 satellite, made available through a sponsorship from members of the VEGETATION programme, including JRC. The legend of the map is based on FAO Land Cover Classification System (LCCS). Later version will also include regional legends.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The general objective is to provide for the year 2000 a harmonized land cover database over the whole globe. The year Two Thousand is considered as a reference year for environmental assessment in relation to various activities, in particular the United Nation's Ecosystem-related International Conventions.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The GVM unit delivers products and services derived from the analysis of satellite remote sensing data to the various DGs of the European Commission, Space Agencies, the scientific community at large and other users. For more information about GVM and other collaborating partners see the GVM website http://www.gvm.jrc.it/default.htm

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: A new land-cover map of Africa for the year 2000

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Land Cover of the World in the Year 2000

gmd19157:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Calculation of omission and commission statistics from sample polygons.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation of the global land cover 2000 map

gmd19157:valueType.gco:RecordType: Confusion matrix recording counts from ground truthing

gmd19157:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: 1. Analysis published in a peer-reviewed journal article with full description of methodology. 2. Original data and reference dataset published via FAO and JRC.

gmd19157:statement.gco:CharacterString: The thematic validation procedure was carried out using design-based inference which conforms to the CEOS Cal-Val recommendations. The resulting research was published in a peer-reviewed journal, and the component datasets generated for the validation may be obtained from JRC.
The thematic validation procedure was carried out using design-based inference which conforms to the CEOS Cal-Val recommendations.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Stratified sampling of ground truth blocks.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Systematic sampling to obtain an irregular stratification with different sampling rates for each stratum.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Joint Research Centre of the European Commission

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Schematic sub-sampling of all GLC2000 landcover categories

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Schematic sub-sampling of all GLC2000 landcover categories

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Interpretation by regional experts of 3x3km sample boxes at specified sample sites. Regional interpreters used ancillary data like aerial photographs, thematic maps and NDVI profiles at coarse resolution in support to the Landsat interpretation.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Local knowledge required to verify exact landcovers at each ground truth point.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Collected table of landcover categories for all sample sites.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Collected table of landcover categories for all sample sites.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Cross-validation of independently interpreted sites against GLC2000 data to generate confusion matrix and Kappa statistic.

gmd19157:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Identification of classes prone to confusion, and overall assessment of the accuracy of the classification.

gmd19157:description.gco:CharacterString: Confusion matrix and overall accuracy value.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Confusion matrix and overall accuracy value.

gvq:knownProblem.gco:CharacterString: Legend issues with South East Asia

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: South East Asia legend mapping: regional classes to GLC2000

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This table gives a full hierarchical mapping from all regional SEA landcover categories to those used in GLC2000

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Climate Data Centre of Norway

gvq:userComment.gvq:comment: Excellent data, but the metadata is inconsistent, which makes it difficult to assess its fitness for purpose.

gvq:rating.gvq:justification: The data itself is of high quality, but the metadata record is patchy. It does comply with ISO 19139, however.

gvq:usage.gvq:usageDescription: I purchased this data for forecasting, and had never dealt with supplier Y before. I found that while the metadata on the supplier's website was compliant with ISO 19139, it was incomplete and I had difficulty assessing the quality of the data before purchase. I evaluated the metadata using the GeoViQua rubric to compare it to the required standards.

gvq:knownProblem.gco:CharacterString: The data itself is of high quality, but this metadata record is patchy. It does comply with ISO 19139, however.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GeoViQua rubric illustrating completeness of the metadata.
